title: Surface-enhanced Raman spectroscopy for the study of interaction of an antibacterial agent ([bis(1,3-dipentyl-1H-imidazol-2(3H)-ylidene)silver(I)]bromide) with Bacillus subtilis bacterial biofilms
content:
RSC Adv., 2024, 14,17389-17396
DOI: 10.1039/D4RA02047B, Paper

Sana Nadeem, Saima Aziz, Haq Nawaz, Muhammad Irfan Majeed, Abeer Ahmed Alghamdi, Muhammad Shahid, Muhammad Adnan Iqbal, Shaista Manahal, Nimra Rehman, Ayesha Anwer, Nida Ghafoor, Muhammad Imran
Surface-enhanced Raman spectroscopy (SERS) is employed to check the antibacterial potential of a lab synthesized imidazole-based drug against biofilm forming bacteria.
